Running.description: Running is a versatile cardio exercise that improves cardiovascular health and endurance. It can be done almost anywhere and requires no equipment.
Running.benefits: Improves cardiovascular health, aids in weight loss, strengthens legs, and improves mental health.

Cycling.description: Cycling, whether on a stationary bike or outdoors, is an effective way to improve cardiovascular fitness and leg strength.
Cycling.benefits: Boosts leg strength, improves joint mobility, decreases stress levels.

Swimming.description: Swimming is a full-body workout that enhances cardiovascular fitness and builds muscle strength.
Swimming.benefits: Provides a low-impact workout, improves endurance and flexibility, good for all fitness levels.

Jump Rope.description: Jump rope is a high-intensity cardiovascular workout that can be done virtually anywhere.
Jump Rope.benefits: Improves coordination, burns significant calories, increases bone density.

Rowing.description: Rowing is an effective cardio workout that also targets various muscle groups.
Rowing.benefits: Enhances cardiovascular fitness, strengthens the back, arms, and legs, low impact on joints.

HIIT.description: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) involves short bursts of intense exercise followed by recovery periods.
HIIT.benefits: Burns a high number of calories, improves metabolic rate, suitable for time-efficient workouts.
